topics.title: Opening Remarks on Decentralized Social Systems
topics.summary: Armeanio opens the meetup discussing how peer-to-peer networks mirror real-life communities, emphasizing the balance between technical parameters and social systems in decentralized networks. He highlights both the benefits and attack vectors of trust-based systems.

topics.title: Market Volatility and Risk Management
topics.summary: Discussion of recent market deleveraging events and the importance of risk management in crypto. Armeanio criticizes the crypto industry's reluctance to discuss risk and draws parallels to traditional monetary policy control systems.

topics.title: Bitcoin's Fixed Parameters vs Traditional Systems
topics.summary: Comparison between Bitcoin's predictable monetary policy and traditional systems where parameters change arbitrarily. Armeanio discusses how proximity to power distribution affects inflation impact and advocates for building systems with set expectations.

topics.title: Building Public Goods and Open Source
topics.summary: Armeanio emphasizes building in public with open, auditable code using SigmaUSD as an example. He introduces the Extended UTXO trilemma concept and discusses creating sustainable flywheels through reusable public goods rather than financial games.

topics.title: Proof of Work and Leaderless Coordination
topics.summary: Explanation of proof of work as a leaderless, apolitical coordination mechanism. Armeanio discusses the distribution of power and skills in decentralized networks, rejecting the concept of singular leadership in favor of specialized contributions.

topics.title: Security Through Time-Tested Research
topics.summary: Armeanio outlines how security forms through research, implementation, and the test of time. He advocates for conservative approaches over constant reinvention, emphasizing that iteration can be innovation and that time is the ultimate test for security.

topics.title: Privacy as Fundamental Right and Future Threat
topics.summary: Discussion of privacy as a critical protection against total economic surveillance. Armeanio warns about potential futures where every transaction is monitored and criticizes 'toy privacy' solutions that create stronger control systems rather than true privacy.

topics.title: Inclusion and Asset Type Classifications
topics.summary: Armeanio addresses the complexity of different asset types in crypto and mentions kushti's work on whitelist mechanisms. He discusses the emergence of regulated assets and the importance of clear assumptions about custodial vs non-custodial, bearer vs non-bearer assets.

topics.title: State Resistance as Core Value
topics.summary: Armeanio argues that state resistance is the only long-term value in cryptocurrency, as everything else trends toward centralization for efficiency. He discusses the Sigma 6 upgrade and emphasizes the importance of clear intent and purpose in crypto development to avoid toxic social systems.

topics.title: Introduction to UTXO Staking Challenges
topics.summary: MGPai introduces Palm staking on UTXO model, explaining existing account model implementations like SushiSwap and PancakeSwap. He details the fundamental differences between UTXO and account models, highlighting UTXO's bottlenecks in storing global state for staking applications.

topics.title: UTXO Staking Solution with Constant Size Data
topics.summary: MGPai explains the solution to UTXO staking limitations using constant-size data storage. He discusses existing position token approaches and why Merkle trees were chosen over derivative markets due to legal conflicts with position tokens.

topics.title: Merkle Tree Data Structure Explanation
topics.summary: Detailed explanation of Merkle tree data structure, including hashing, tree traversal, and how changes propagate through the tree. MGPai demonstrates how Merkle trees enable efficient difference detection between states with logarithmic complexity.

topics.title: Merkle Patricia Trie and Proof Verification
topics.summary: MGPai explains the optimized Merkle Patricia trie structure and the proof verification process. He details how membership is proven by comparing computed root hashes with known roots, and addresses questions about data recovery and security assumptions.

topics.title: Contract Integration and Off-chain Data Storage
topics.summary: Discussion of how contracts integrate with the trie structure for verification-only operations and off-chain data storage requirements. MGPai addresses concerns about platform reliability and explains how data can be recovered from blockchain history through redeemer/context data.

topics.title: Dynamic Emission Protocol Improvements
topics.summary: MGPai describes improvements made to the original staking protocol, particularly the implementation of dynamic emission rates that can adjust weekly without contract redeployment. This allows for fine-grained control during market volatility and economic changes.

topics.title: Centralization Issues in DeFi Protocols
topics.summary: MGPai discusses centralization problems in DeFi, using Liquid Finance's front-end shutdown as an example. He explains how many Cardano protocols use permissioned off-chain runners requiring special NFTs, creating centralized control points despite running on decentralized platforms.

topics.title: Nautilus Wallet Integration Proposal
topics.summary: Discussion of integrating HODLerg and other applications directly into Nautilus wallet to eliminate front-end dependencies. This would provide users with their own app instances, reducing risks from website hacks and domain takeovers while maintaining full functionality.

topics.title: GluonW Stablecoin Protocol Introduction
topics.summary: Luca begins presentation on GluonW, a cryptocurrency stablecoin protocol, acknowledging co-author Bruno's contributions to the research paper.
